meanings.definition: The property of certain materials to become magnetized in the presence of a magnetic field.
meanings.sent1: Ferromagnetisms can be observed in iron and nickel.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study ferromagnetisms to understand how materials respond to magnetic fields.
meanings.sent3: The party theme was ferromagnetisms, with guests attracting to each other like magnets.
meanings.sent4: Her love for him was like the ferromagnetisms between two poles, strong and undeniable.
meanings.sent5: The ferromagnetisms of the fridge kept the magnets in place, showcasing their magnetic power.

meanings.definition: The study of the magnetic properties of ferromagnetic materials.
meanings.sent1: Understanding ferromagnetisms helps in developing new technologies.
meanings.sent2: Researchers in ferromagnetisms aim to enhance magnetic storage devices.
meanings.sent3: The professor's passion for ferromagnetisms was magnetic, drawing students to the subject.
meanings.sent4: In the world of technology, ferromagnetisms is the compass guiding innovation.
meanings.sent5: The laboratory was filled with the hum of machines studying ferromagnetisms, a symphony of magnetic exploration.
